short_description: This function generates encoded ordinal integer values for each category in a target column.
long_description: This function takes a input table partitioned by ANY and a target categorical column and generates integer ordinal values for each unique category in the target column.

input_tables.name: InputTable
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the table containing the input categorical target column.
input_tables.description: Specifies the table containing the input categorical target column.

output_tables.name: OutputTable
output_tables.rDescription: Name for the table that the function will generate when OUT clause is provided.
output_tables.description: Name for the table that the function will generate when OUT clause is provided.

argument_clauses.name: TargetColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specify the categorical input target column.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the categorical input target column.

argument_clauses.name: Approach
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether to determine categories automatically from the input table data (AUTO approach) or the user provided list (LIST approach).
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether to determine categories automatically from the input table data (AUTO approach) or the user provided list (LIST approach).

argument_clauses.name: Categories
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the list of categories that need to be encoded in the desired order.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the list of categories that need to be encoded in the desired order.

argument_clauses.name: OrdinalValues
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies custom ordinal values to replace the categories.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies custom ordinal values to replace the categories.

argument_clauses.name: StartValue
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the starting value for ordinal values list.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the starting value for ordinal values list.

argument_clauses.name: DefaultValue
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the ordinal value to use when category is not found.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the ordinal value to use when category is not found.
